Torque itself is an excellent app, although it seems to be somewhat abandoned as far as development is concerned. Strange there is not a HONDA Civic specific PID addon yet ... But Torque Widgets brought my Head unit to a grinding stuttering halt, as soon as I installed it. I had not even got to set any widgets up on my Home Screen !! Touch response on the screen was VERY lagged, and MP3 player stuttered as it played. Animation in other apps became jerky. As soon as figured out it was Torque Widgets doing this (some 5 hours later of messing with the head unit) and I uninstalled Torque Widgets APP, everything returned to normal. Reasonably modern Px5 Unit, Android 8, 4 Gigs Ram, 8 core - did not expect this performance hit with Torque Widgets :( Would very much prefer this was fixed, vs getting a refund.

With china tablet and china elm bluetooth adapter. Ppl who are giving bad reviews have no ideea what are talking about  LE: Since the latest (4-6) updates on the main app, the widgets are freezing data from time to time, even while car engine is working and obd connection to ecu is enabled.  Also on short trip breaks (car engine stopped) from 5 seconds to 5 minutes or more the data on widgets also freezes and the toggle on/off widget must be activated in order to get live data again. Unfortunately, this resets the trips data collected so far (avg speed, trip consumption ... etc)  I wish there were more options rather than just to toggle data reading on/off ... for instance: option to reset trip readings (manually, rather than auto as it is now), option to set the break times bigger than 10 minutes as it is now ... option to reset each widgets collected data so far by long pres on the specific dial (for ex: long time average fuel consumption can only be reset by going in the main app ... which takes to much time)   This used to be a great app  for me, I also have the pro torque installed, but now it's just a source of great anointment, when all the data on widgets is frozen ..

content: Widgets don't work at all. Nothing.

Slow to update and slow to refresh once you come back to home screen. The on/off widget is tricky to use also. Sometimes it will work, sometimes it ignores your request. Not good companion to the actual Torque Pro application.
replyContent:
Hi
In some instances (particularly if data logging uploads are enabled) Torque will wait for the upload to finish before it shuts down.This may be why you are having trouble with the 'toggle' widget.  Give it time and it will shutdown fully. Speed is dependant on the homescreen app - you may find using the default homescreen is significantly faster

content: Works great

Same complaint as some of the other users. I haven't even put any widgets on my desktop, but this thing keeps loading Torque in the background, starting my bluetooth and trying to start GPS. I can't stress enough how much the latter two are battery drain issues and how much the first is a memory issue when you are no where near your car! Even killing the process manually in conjunction with a forced close of torque still leads to it restarting itself again within a few seconds. Totally annoying!
replyContent:
Hi!

It says in the description it will cause Torque to start automatically by default - if you don't want that, then use the 'OBD TOGGLE' widget to turn it off/on

content: Having this installed, Torque always starts by itself a short time after you exit manually, even if no widgets have been added to any screen, draining the battery!
